title: Star-studded consortium 'made bid for League One Wycombe Wanderers'
text:
A star-studded consortium involving Dennis Bergkamp, Henrik Larsson and Dirk Kuyt were reportedly close to completing a shock takeover of League One club Wycombe Wanderers.

The trio of former players, who were planning to work with Holland manager Ronald Koeman as an advisor, wanted to buy and run the club themselves, with Larsson joining Gareth Ainsworth's coaching staff, according to the The Athletic.

The bid was made earlier this year and a deal in principle was close to being agreed, with Bergkamp, Larsson and Kuyt even depositing money into bank accounts in Holland as talks progressed.

Henrik Larsson was part of a big-name consortium who made a bid for League One Wycombe

Arsenal legend Dennis Bergkamp, pictured in 1998, was also involved in the takeover attempt

Another unnamed former Dutch international was also involved in the ambitious takeover, which was designed to 'catapult Wycombe into stardom'.

According to the report, the quartet of stars have been keen to become the first group of leading ex-players to purchase an EFL club and run it on a daily basis for some time.

They had planned to wipe out the club's debts and then help it grow by using their 'expertise, experience and contacts', with former Liverpool forward Kuyt making regular visits to help with the development of young coaches.

The trio of former players had hoped to work at Adams Park and help the club achieve success

Former Liverpool forward Dirk Kuyt had planned to visit Wycombe and develop young coaches

However, despite serious progress on a deal being made, Wycombe's board pulled the plug and chose to pursue another takeover offer.

The club, who are riding high in second place in League One, are now on the brink of being sold to American businessman Rob Couhig, with a final decision expected this month.

The Athletic report that Bergkamp, Larsson and Kuyt remain determined to realise their ambition of owning an English club and could even return to the negotiating table with Wycombe should the current takeover fail to materialise.

The trio's vision for The Chairboys included Bergkamp relaunching the club's academy, the medical department being improved and the possibility of a documentary on Netflix or Amazon Prime to cover the club's new start.

The club's Adams Park ground has a capacity of just 9,448.

Prior to their bid falling through, a source close to the consortium told The Athletic: 'We're not coming over pretending to know everything.

'We know a lot and we're going to bring that together with the people working at the club to make it a joint venture. It's a family club and we have to treat family as family.'
description: A star-studded consortium involving Dennis Bergkamp, Henrik Larsson and Dirk Kuyt were close to completing a shock takeover of League One Wycombe Wanderers, according to The Athletic.
